summary.label:
Has it ever happened that you have to meet someone and the person can't explain where he/she is? This app will quickly find the location of another phone by sending a text message request. Most phones manufactured after 2010 can accept this request, no need to install any additional app on the 2nd person's phone. It does not get any easier than this!

How it is working:

• User A wants to know a User B location.

• User A enters the phone number of User B into the app.

• The app generates a unique URL, and the URL is sent to User B.

• If User B clicks on the link, user A will see the location of user B.

Limitations:

• This is not a spy app. User B must agree to share the location with you.

• If User B has a device without GPS (desktop computer, tablet), the determined location may have a large accuracy margin (up to 5 km).

• In rare situations, when user B is behind the corporate proxy, the app can show the proxy's location, not the user's.

The user location is determined in three ways:

• E.123, E.164
• RIR
• W3C Geolocation API

• Latitude & Longitude coordinates (decimal degrees and degrees/minutes/seconds)
• Elevation (meters and feet above sea level)

• Device direction (degrees true and degrees magnetic)
• Direction of device movement (degrees true)

• Elevation (meters and feet above sea level)
• Speed (meters and feet per second, kilometers and miles per hour, and knots)
• Direction of device movement (degrees true)
• Latitude & Longitude coordinates (decimal degrees and degrees/minutes/seconds)

Apple Watch uses the paired iPhone nearby for GPS information. Apple Watch with built-in GPS will use the built-in GPS when the paired iPhone is unavailable.

GPS Data only requests to use Location Services while in use, making it perfect for those with privacy or battery consumption concerns.

On iOS devices without GPS capabilities, including iPad Wi-Fi models and iPod Touch, location data will be calculated from nearby Wi-Fi hotspots, which will be less accurate than GPS. On iOS devices without onboard barometer, local air pressure will be unavailable, and vertical speed will be calculated from GPS location instead of pressure change.

# User-friendly Design #
Your current location will automatically appear as the point of intersection of two grey lines, and can also be manually indicated via value-input, location search, and import from clipboard functions as well.

Not only the app specifies Longitude / Latitude, but also supports a number of coordinate formats and systems, i.e., Universal Transverse Mercator Coordinate System (UTM), Military Grid Reference System (MGRS), World Geographic Reference System (Georef), etc. 

# Datum Conversion #
The app is able to transform coordinates within EPSG , ESRI, IAU2000 references from online database, and convert X & Y coordinates, geodetic datums and projected systems.

Pin your desired location on the map to start navigation. Real-time bearing/distance update and large coordinate readout for on-the-field usage are available.

Elevation/altitude data is accessible within landmass area.

summary.label:
Find your current elevation, altitude, and height above sea level easily with this altimeter/barometer app.



## Elevation Finder ##


This app helps you observe the elevations of all locations on the surface of the earth by simply touch and move the map around, or input the address/location name. You can also find the elevation of your current location by using online database, built-in GPS, or barometer on your device.



Elevation data benefits flood prevention, prediction of water levels in rivers, lakes, and seas, etc. Thus, knowing the elevation of places is very crucial if you are looking for a flood-free house, or planning for a hiking trip, and more.  



## Could-based Altitude Data ##
The easiest way to find altitude of any location on earth. By simply point on the screen, you can get the elevation data from a coordinate location point. “Range Mode” is available for altitude comparison (by graph and line) of each point between two selected locations. 




## GPS Altitude Data ##
Use built-in GPS on your device to determine the altitude of your current location. The altitude data of the area you walked-through will be recorded and displayed as a multicolored line on the map. The colors presented on the line indicate different heights. Precision indicators (horizontal resolution and vertical resolution) are displayed on the screen.



## Barometric Altitude Data ##
Use built-in barometer on your device to determine the elevation of your current location. You can either measure the elevation from raw barometric data, or relative pressure from sea-level. Like GPS data, the result is displayed as a multicolored line.



To get the most accurate data, it is recommended to adjust the sea level pressure and temperature prior to the measurement, and set the offset or calibration value if necessary. 



## Standalone Barometer ##
You can use this app as a standalone barometer.



## Air Pressure / Altitude Calculator ##
Atmospheric pressure and/or altitude at your current location are calculated from known altitude, pressure of the location, temperature and/or sea level pressure.


## Support of Coordinate Formats ##
This app not only displays regular latitude and longitude data, but also supports many coordinate systems such as, Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) coordinate system and Military Grid Reference System (MGRS) and more.

## Export of Data ##
From this app, you can export many useful information including timestamp, altitude, pressure, and coordinates.

Triplinx is the official trip planner and transportation information resource for the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area (GTHA).

It covers the following transit agencies:
Barrie Transit
Brampton Transit
Burlington Transit
Durham Region Transit (DRT)
GO Transit (GO)
Grand River Transit
Hamilton Street Railway (HSR)
Milton Transit
Mississauga Transit (MiWay)

Niagara Region Transit
Oakville Transit
Pearson Terminal Link
St. Catharines Transit Commission
Toronto Ferries
Toronto Transit Commission (TTC)
Union Pearson Express (UP Express)
WEGO
York Region Transit (YRT)

And modes:
Subway
Train
Bus
Streetcar
Ferry
Bike
Bikeshare
Bicycle
Car
Carpool

We've been continuously improving Triplinx to serve you better. We are pleased to share a new version of Triplinx. This version now offers integrated real time transit departure information throughout the application along with several other enhancements.  The real-time information is currently available for TTC (bus and streetcars only), HSR and YRT.  Other agencies will be added when their data is available.

New features include:
• Next departures (real-time where available) by clicking on a stop on the map
• Real time information included in the trip planner, schedules, and nearby information
• Routes near your current location using "Around me"
• Search a stop or a route with the "Search" feature
• Convenient real time information for your "favourites" 
• Improved presentation of stops and main routes on the map

Planning your trip is easy – simply enter your starting location and where you want to go, and Triplinx will tell you how to get there. You can customize your trip plan using the options such as maximum walking distance or mode of transportation. Triplinx is designed to provide information on trips using transit (combined with walk, cycle, or drive) as well as cycling or walking for the entire trip.
